title: New Delhi on high alert following religious violence between Hindus and Muslims on its outskirts
description: With just a few months to go before the Indian general elections, the increase in tensions confirms the polarization of a society made up of the Hindu majority and the Muslim community.

title: US Navy men arrested for allegedly spying for China
description: The two men are suspected of selling secret information including manuals for warships and their weapons systems, as well as blueprints for a radar system and plans for a huge US military exercise.

title: Flooding persists in Beijing three days after the passage of super typhoon Doksuri
description: The Chinese capital recorded its heaviest rainfall in at least 140 years, causing at least 21 deaths while 26 persons are still left missing.

title: Trump pleads not guilty to federal charges that he tried to overturn the 2020 election
description: The 77-year-old billionaire has already been charged in two other criminal cases, and the new conspiracy charges raise the prospect of his being further embroiled in legal proceedings at the height of next year's election campaign.

title: War in Ukraine: Russian shelling hits a landmark church in Kherson
description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russia so far has launched at least 1,961 Shahed drones, adding that "a significant number of them have been shot down."

title: Niger: US charters plane to evacuate Americans from coup-hit country
description: A handful of US citizens have already boarded flights chartered by France and Italy in recent days.

title: Trump heads to court to face election conspiracy charges
description: The 77-year-old billionaire has already been charged in two other criminal cases, and the new conspiracy charges raise the prospect of his being further embroiled in legal proceedings at the height of next year's election campaign.

title: In Bregançon, Macron spends his summer under pressure
description: In the fall, the French president and his government will have to deal with social unrest, the energy transition, an immigration bill, and the budget. All while still lacking enough support in Parliament.

title: Women's World Cup: Morocco to face France after 1-0 win over Colombia
description: One of the lowest-ranked teams at the tournament at 72 in the world, Morocco faces France on Tuesday in the knockouts.

title: Paris airport pandemonium after bag handler breaks
description: A breakdown in luggage-sorting equipment at Orly airport meant many flights left late and without the luggage of their passengers on board.

title: Niger: West African coup leaders close ranks as region's powers threaten intervention
description: The second-in-command of the Niger junta visited Bamako and Ouagadougou. The ultimatum imposed on General Tiani by ECOWAS to hand over power expires on Sunday.

title: In rare criticism, North Korea calls French military exercises 'irresponsible'
description: The deployment of French troops in July alongside South Korea's army comes as part of Seoul's effort to boost cooperation with NATO.

title: The jewels of Aregund, queen of the Franks, reveal a sophisticated society
description: 'An underground history of France' (8/12). The sarcophagus of King Clovis's daughter-in-law, who died at the end of the 6th century, was discovered in the Basilica of Saint-Denis in 1959. The refinement of its funerary furnishings spoke of her great wealth.

title: French police use sick leave to protest detention of colleague
description: Thousands of officers have expressed solidarity with a Marseille colleague remanded in custody in a case of police violence.

title: French officer charged with violence in Marseille to stay in jail
description: Hedi, 22, suffered severe head injuries in the southern French city after he was beaten by police officers in early July.

title: Donald Trump: The main investigations threatening the former US president
description: A number of investigations involving tax evasion and election fraud are ongoing, both at the state and federal levels.

title: Typhoon Doksuri: Beijing's historic floods, in photos
description: Intense rainfall in the Chinese capital has caused at least 21 deaths. Evacuations are still taking place.

title: The inevitable moment of truth for democracy in the United States
description: At stake in Donald Trump's indictment for 'conspiring to defraud the United States' is one of the pillars of American democracy: the peaceful transfer of power after elections. This is what the former president has openly attacked head-on.

title: Niger: Hundreds gather in Niamey in pro-coup rally
description: The demonstration is taking place on the day the country celebrates independence from France.

title: Beating of Hedi R.: Investigators reconstruct violent attack by Marseille police
description: The young man suffered severe head injuries during an altercation in the southern French city amidst the riots following the police killing of Nahel M. Witness testimony and camera footage are helping judges in their investigation.

title: France asks Niger to 'fully guarantee' embassy safety
description: Paris evacuated French nationals from the country, while London and Washington are reducing their diplomatic presence.

title: 'Bola Tinubu's credibility will depend on what he can do in Niger'
description: As the head of ECOWAS, the Nigerian president will have to show that he can be decisive on defense issues, says researcher Benjamin Augé, in an interview.

title: Konrad Klapheck, a painter who colored outside the lines, has died
description: The German artist, who was one of the first to inscribe the power of machines in art, died on July 30 at the age of 88.

title: How France has adapted since the deadly 2003 heatwave
description: Twenty years ago, an extreme heat episode claimed the lives of 15,000 people, exposing the authorities' failures.

title: 'Extensive war crimes' and 'unimaginable horror' in Sudan, says Amnesty International
description: The human rights group's 56-page report said civilians were deliberately targeted, killed and wounded by warring parties since the East African country plunged into chaos in mid-April.

title: Patrick Drahi's empire weakened by partner's downfall
description: The arrest last month of Armando Pereira, Altice's former number two, is threatening the financial situation of the telecoms and mass media company.

title: Iran orders two-day nationwide shutdown due to unprecedented heat
description: The government decreed the closure of banks, schools and public offices, while temperatures topped 50°C in the south of the country.

title: Russian oligarchs get richer from the war in Ukraine
description: Metals, chemicals and fuels sold to the army generate profits for some Russian industrialists. Hoping to avoid sanctions, some of them deny the dynamic.
